title: Changing location of bookmarks
content: I'm trying Firefox again after many years in the Edgy wilderness. In Firefox in Windows, you used to be able to specify where your bookmarks were located. I store all my files (documents, spreadsheets, etc) in a complex structure on my C drive and, ideally, I should be able to store my Firefox bookmarks in the same structure. It just doesn't make sense to store the bookmarks in a separate location. I'm pretty sure you used to be able to do this by specifying the root of the bookmarks structure as c:/Documents, but I can't see how to do it in the current version.
creator: DaleLaceyNZ

title: Navegador Firefox about:config
content:
Olá, estou buscando uma funcionalidade que vi anteriormente quando acessei um FIrefox. Trata-se de uma personalização no about:config onde a funcionalidade permite que ao eu digitar a introdução um website na barra de endereço do navegador, ele exibe os links das sub páginas relacionadas ao website que estou acessando. Qual é o nome da configuração onde consigo essa personalização?

Atenciosamente, Raiff.
creator: raiffcantalice

title: After latest update (123.0) usernames and passwords are not auto filling
content:
Hi, After latest update (123.0) usernames and passwords are not auto filling.

- I noticed that "Ask to save passwords" is unchecked and not configurable(or grayed out). - I tried troubleshoot mode and did refresh too, no use. - History setting is set to "Always remember history".

Note: I see the banner: "Your browser is being managed by your organization.", There I dont see any of these settings controlled except primary password is turned off.
creator: sateesh752

title: Google Meet "You can't join this video call" as a guest user
content: I am using Firefox as a browser to scrape data from Google Meet. However, while it works fine on Google Chrome, I encounter an error when using Firefox, which states: 'You can't join this video call.'
creator: abhishek96negi

title: Bookmarks toolbar keeps disappearing
content: When using private browsing window, bookmarks toolbar keeps disappearing every time I open a new tab or anything else. My setting for show bookmarks is "always show" and it works normally in a regular window. It also used to work normally in private browsing until a few days ago. Clicking "show bookmarks toolbar" works until I open any of the bookmarks, then the toolbar disappears again. How do I make the toolbar permanently visible in a private browsing window?
creator: taja.skristan

title: Non memorizza
content: Windows 11 Dopo decine e decine di tentativi di ripristino, ogni qual volta che riapro il browser Firefox le mie credenziali non sono state memorizzate e quindi devo riscrivere ogni volta email e pass in ogni sito web che uso giornalmente. Come posso risolvere ? Ripeto: ho già eseguito tanti tentativi di ripristino. Cordiali saluti Salvatore
creator: salvatore57magagnino

title: Parou de funcionar
content:
Olá Mestres bom dia, até a tarde de ontem dia 26/02/2024 usei meu Firefox normalemnte, hoje ao ligar op PC , as paginas salvas em favoritos e TODAS as demais não carregarm, mostra apenas NOVA ABA. Acessei ajuda, restaurei, ressetei, desinstalei, reinstalei, removi novamente, limpei os dados no registro do Windows 10 reinstalei mais uma vez a versão atualizada, e nada. Não consigo sinronizar na minha conta, não abre nem mesmo o about:config Fica tudo numa tela em branco , sem a barrinha inferior de carregando site etc... Uso o ESET INTERNET SECURITY, habilitei manualmente o firewall dele hoje para liberar o trafego de IDA E VOLTA do Firefox e Mozilla Maintenance sem sucesso algum. Uso como extensão o proprio ESET que oferece a proteção de navegador. a qual já desabilitei , e também não fez efeito algum, e uso ainda o cofre de senhas BITWARDEN, lembro que ambas sempre funcionaram com total perfeição no Firefox, inclusive até ontem à tarde...... Peço por favor que me orientem sobre uma possível solução. e desde já agradeço

At Guido
creator: guido29

title: Firefox not preventing sleep
content:
Hello,

I have a problem with Firefox on Linux, doesn't seem to be distro specific as I've tried Manjaro/Ubuntu/Neon, when using KDE in that when listening to music on YouTube music my computer will go to sleep after the elected time. On KDE you can see which applications are preventing sleep and/or screen lock, other applications are listed here but not Firefox.

When playing a video everything works as expected.

I would investigate myself, but I don't know where to start so if someone can point me in the right direction or offer any insights?

Currently using: KDE Neon KDE 6.0 Kernel 6.5.0-21 Wayland
creator: dclark16

title: cycling through previous typed chat messages with up and down arrow
content: Maybe my cat walked over a certain key and disabled something or the new version of firefox won't let me cycle through previous typed chat messages anymore. while streaming on twitch i have to repeat certain chat messages which i did by typing the up and down arrows. lately it doesn't work in firefox anymore (OBS has a chat box which still has this function tho) is there an option to disable/enable cycling through previously typed text and which key does that?

title: Just got FireFox. Need help knowing if its using too much memory.
content: Just downloaded Firefox a day ago; since a friend told me that its better than Edge. It seemed fine at first and then went and looked at task manager. It's using way more memory than Edge. Firefox has 19 separate tasks running totaling to ~1,500 MB. I need to know what I can do to lower it. My friend made it sound like Firefox was way less memory intensive. I don't even keep 10 tabs open at a time. Any help would be appreciated.
